p: Global analysis suggests in a few cases that OP may encourage forest reversion and lower global emissions, mainly because OP plantations store more carbon than alternative agricultural land uses. However, this is valid only where degraded lands, such as grassland in Indonesia and cattle pastures in the Amazon, are used for OP cultivation; a solution embraced by environmentalist and policymakers (WRI, 2015). OP is even more acceptable if policymakers: (1) stop deforestation, (2) introduce peatland restoration policies, (c) support smallholder farms, and (d) involve local communities in palm oil business. Thus, OP cultivation alleviates poverty and could transform livelihood of millions of people with suitable governmental policies (Barcelos etÂ al., 2015).
